memberdef.definition: typedef boost::adjacency_list<boost::vecS, boost::vecS, boost::undirectedS, Vmap> CGAL::Mean_curvature_flow_skeletonization< TriangleMesh, Traits_, VertexPointMap_, SolverTraits_ >::Skeleton
memberdef.name: Skeleton

briefdescription.para: The graph type representing the skeleton. The vertex property Vmap is a struct with a member point of type Traits::Point_3 and a member vertices of type std::vector<boost::graph_traits<TriangleMesh>::vertex_descriptor>. See the boost documentation page for more details.

memberdef.argsstring: (const TriangleMesh &tmesh, VertexPointMap vertex_point_map=get(CGAL::vertex_point, tmesh), Traits traits=Traits())
memberdef.name: Mean_curvature_flow_skeletonization

briefdescription.para: The constructor of a skeletonization object.

detaileddescription.para:
The algorithm parameters are initialized such that:
max_triangle_angle() == 110
quality_speed_tradeoff() == 0.1
medially_centered_speed_tradeoff() == 0.2
area_variation_factor() == 0.0001
max_iterations() == 500
is_medially_centered() == true
min_edge_length() == 0.002 * the length of the diagonal of the bounding box of tmesh

simplesect.para: tmesh is a triangulated surface mesh without borders and has exactly one connected component.

parameterdescription.para: property map which associates a point to each vertex of the graph.
an instance of the traits class.

briefdescription.para: During the local remeshing step, a triangle will be split if it has an angle larger than max_triangle_angle().
During the local remeshing step, an edge will be collapse if it is length is less than min_edge_length().
set function for max_triangle_angle()
set function for min_edge_length()
Maximum number of iterations performed by contract_until_convergence().

The convergence is considered to be reached if the variation of the area of the meso-skeleton after one iteration is smaller than area_variation_factor()*original_area where original_area is the area of the input triangle mesh.
set function for max_iterations()
set function for area_variation_factor()

Controls the velocity of movement and approximation quality: decreasing this value makes the mean curvature flow based contraction converge faster, but results in a skeleton of lower quality. This parameter corresponds to $ w_H $ in the original publication.
If true, the meso-skeleton placement will be attracted by an approximation of the medial axis of the mesh during the contraction steps, so will be the result skeleton.

Controls the smoothness of the medial approximation: increasing this value results in a (less smooth) skeleton closer to the medial axis, as well as a lower convergence speed. It is only used if is_medially_centered()==true. This parameter corresponds to $ w_M $ in the original publication.
set function for quality_speed_tradeoff()
set function for is_medially_centered()
set function for medially_centered_speed_tradeoff()
Creates the curve skeleton: the input surface mesh is iteratively contracted until convergence, and then turned into a curve skeleton.

detaileddescription.para: This is equivalent to calling contract_until_convergence() and convert_to_skeleton().

parameterdescription.para: graph that will contain the skeleton of the input triangulated surface mesh. For each vertex descriptor vd of skeleton, the corresponding point and the set of input vertices that contracted to vd can be retrieved using skeleton[vd].point and skeleton[vd].vertices respectively.

description.para: The following functions enable the user to run the mean curvature flow skeletonization algorithm step by step.

briefdescription.para: Runs one contraction step following the mean curvature flow.
Collapses edges of the meso-skeleton with length less than min_edge_length() and returns the number of edges collapsed.
Splits faces of the meso-skeleton having one angle greater than max_triangle_angle() and returns the number of faces split.
Prevents degenerate vertices to move during the following contraction steps and returns the number of newly fixed vertices.
Performs subsequent calls to contract_geometry(), collapse_edges(), split_faces() and detect_degeneracies()

Iteratively calls contract() until the change of surface area of the meso-skeleton after one iteration is smaller than area_variation_factor()*original_area where original_area is the area of the input triangle mesh, or if the maximum number of iterations has been reached.
Converts the contracted surface mesh to a skeleton curve.

parameterdescription.para: an instantiation of boost::adjacency_list as a data structure for the skeleton curve.
graph that will contain the skeleton of tmesh. It should be empty before passed to the function.

memberdef.definition: typedef unspecified_type CGAL::Mean_curvature_flow_skeletonization< TriangleMesh, Traits_, VertexPointMap_, SolverTraits_ >::Meso_skeleton
memberdef.name: Meso_skeleton

briefdescription.para: When using the low level API it is possible to access the intermediate results of the skeletonization process, called meso-skeleton. It is a triangulated surface mesh which is model of FaceListGraph.
Reference to the collapsed triangulated surface mesh.

briefdescription.para: The meso-skeleton.
Storing indices of all vertices.

Storing the point for mTriangleMesh vertex_descriptor.

Controling the velocity of movement and approximation quality.
Controling the smoothness of the medial approximation.
Edges with length less than min_edge_length will be collapsed.
Triangles with angle greater than alpha_TH will be split.
Value very close to zero.
contract_until_convergence will stop if the change of area in one iteration is less than delta_area.

detaileddescription.para: vertices with ids greater than m_max_id are created during split, thus will not be considered in correspondence tracking.

briefdescription.para: Used when assembling the matrix.
The incident angle for a halfedge.
The normal of surface points.
Initialize the parameters for Mean_curvature_flow_skeletonization.

The order of vertex id is the same as the traverse order.

memberdef.argsstring: (const vertex_descriptor vs, const vertex_descriptor vt, const vertex_descriptor vk, const vertex_descriptor vnew)
memberdef.name: project_vertex

briefdescription.para: Project the vertex vk to the line of vs and vt.
Split triangles with an angle greater than alpha_TH.
Test degeneracy of a vertex by counting the euler characteristic of its local neighborhood disk.
Compute the Voronoi pole for surface vertices. The pole is the furthest vertex in the Voronoi cell containing the given vertex.
Compute an approximate vertex normal for all vertices.
Function object that enables to extract the mean curvature flow skeleton of a triangulated surface mesh.

detaileddescription.para: The algorithm used takes as input a triangulated surface mesh and iteratively contracts the surface mesh following the mean curvature flow [1]. The intermediate contracted surface mesh is called the meso-skeleton. After each iteration, the meso-skeleton is locally remeshed using angle split and edge contraction. The process ends when the modification of the meso-skeleton between two iterations is small.

parameterdescription.para: a model of MeanCurvatureSkeletonizationTraits Default: CGAL::Kernel_traits< boost::property_traits< boost::property_map<TriangleMesh,CGAL::vertex_point_t>::type >::value_type >::Kernel

a model of ReadWritePropertyMap with boost::graph_traits<TriangleMesh>::vertex_descriptor as key and Traits::Point_3 as value type. Default: boost::property_map<TriangleMesh,CGAL::vertex_point_t>::const_type.

a model of NormalEquationSparseLinearAlgebraTraits_d. Default: If Eigen 3.2 (or greater) is available and CGAL_EIGEN3_ENABLED is defined, then an overload of Eigen_solver_traits is provided as default parameter: CGAL::Eigen_solver_traits< Eigen::SimplicialLDLT<Eigen::SparseMatrix<double>> >
